channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report E-2024020483
item.description:
Report E-2024020483

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: SALEM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XSW experienced a UN3265 Dequest 2000 release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30-gallons of product released to a 5’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor and a 20’ x 8’ area of the concrete lot below due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents and soda ash were deployed to neutralize and clean the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were then collected into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged drum of material was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024020378
item.description:
Report E-2024020378

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-16
  • City: SALEM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS regarding a punctured 1-gallon jug of Rooto Professional Drain Opener as a result of dunnage. A Contractor was called to clean-up the release and overpack the damaged product. Two drums of waste were generate for disposal; one drum of overpacked product, and one drum of neutralized rags an oil dry. The release had impacted the wooden dock floor and the asphalt beneath the trailer. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by the spill.

Tote was taken to a QA area and contents arranged to prevent more leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024020721
item.description:
Report X-2024020721

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-29
  • City: CHAMPAIGN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A driver brought this over to QA due to a very small leak at the bottom. The driver already had it sitting under absorbent pads. DescribePack: There is a small puncture on the bottom of the drum that was caused more than likely from the drum being dropped. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was brought to the hazmat processing area and absorbent pads were placed underneath the drum.
